front.title: Security Requirements for a Light Weight Access Point Protocol

abstract.t: LWAPP defines the interactions of wireless lan infrastructure components, including access points (APs) and access routers (ARs). The AR represents a centralized point of management control in such infrastructures, implying critical control signalling between APs and ARs. Given the open nature of WLANs, a careful analysis of security threats is required, and appropriate security countermeasures must be defined. This document provides a security analysis and makes recommendations for securing LWAPP
